intro: Impatiens scabriuscula, commonly known as the rough-stemmed impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and heart-shaped, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, white, and red, which bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses worldwide.
